Basic Queries

Selecting


For this and many of the following problems you will create queries that retrieve the relevant information from the Portal small mammal survey data that you imported in the Importing Tables problem. You may need to know more about the database than you currently do in order to answer the questions. For example, you may need to know what species is associated with the two character species ID or you may need to know the units for the individualâ€™s weight. This type of information associated with data is called metadata and the metadata for this dataset is available online at Ecological Archives.

  1. Open the table with the Portal Survey Data that you created in the Importing Tables problem. Click the button at the bottom that looks like >| to jump to the end of the table. How many records are there? If you open the raw data file in Excel how many lines are there? Do they match (keeping in mind that one row in the raw data file is the headers)? If not then there was an error in your import. You should always do some basic santity checks like this one when working with computers to make sure that they are doing what you think they are doing.
  2. Write a query that displays all of the records for all of the fields in the table. Save it as All Survey Data.
  3. We want to generate data for an analysis of body size differences between males and females of each species. We have decided that we can ignore the information related to when and where the individuals were trapped. Create a query that returns all of the necessary information, but nothing else. Save this as Size Differences Among Sexes Data.
